Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

I've been experimenting with building visual REST applications =96 I
used f=
revvo <http://www.frevvo.com>  and Restlet
<http://www.restlet.org>  (I wor=
k for frevvo). I've posted a couple of
blog articles about my experiences a=
nd I was wondering how other people
are building visual web applications wi=
th REST. You can find much more
including diagrams, examples and source cod=
e at:

Visual REST apps: Part 1 <http://www.frevvo.com/blog/?p=3D26>
Visual=
 REST apps: Part 2 <http://www.frevvo.com/blog/?p=3D32>

I tend to think in=
 terms of View Resource (forms) that compose Entity
Resources (documents). =
The View Resource can update existing entities,
create new ones, store loca=
lly or update remotely =96 all in a uniform
RESTful manner. IMO, it's a ver=
y powerful and flexible way to interact
with the web and create REST applic=
ations that handle complex visual
elements without compromising REST princi=
ples.I'd be very interested in
your thoughts.

Thx,
-Ashish

--5-2387157788-6125694666=:9
Content-Type: text/html; charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

I've been experimenting with building visual REST applications =96 I used <=
a href=3D"http://www.frevvo.com">frevvo</a> and <a href=3D"http://www.restl=
et.org">Restlet</a> (I work for frevvo). I've posted a couple of blog artic=
les about my experiences and I was wondering how other people are building =
visual web applications with REST. You can find much more including diagram=
s, examples and source code at:<br><br><a href=3D"http://www.frevvo.com/blo=
g/?p=3D26">Visual REST apps: Part 1</a><br><a href=3D"http://www.frevvo.com=
/blog/?p=3D32">Visual REST apps: Part 2</a><br><br>I tend to think in terms=
 of View Resource (forms) that compose Entity Resources (documents). The Vi=
ew Resource can update existing entities, create new ones, store locally or=
 update remotely =96 all in a uniform RESTful manner. IMO, it's a very powe=
rful and flexible way to interact with the web and create REST applications=
 that handle complex visual elements without compromising REST principles.I=
'd be very interested in your thoughts.<br><br>Thx,<br>-Ashish

--5-2387157788-6125694666=:9--
